data.event: European settlement of the region began in 1861 with the opening of the lands to pastoralists, with some cattle stations still in operation.
Coal was discovered in 1866 but it wasn't until 1912 that large-scale mining operations commenced.
Coal was discovered in 1866 but it wasn't until 1912 that large-scale mining operations commenced.
On 20 September 1921 it was officially renamed Collinsville after Charles Collins who was the Labor Member of the Queensland Legislative Assembly for Bowen from 1915 to 1936.
Collinsville State School opened on 27 June 1921.
Collinsville Post Office opened on 21 May 1923 (a receiving office had been open from 1922).
